p: Depressive symptoms were measured using the nine-item Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9) scale (Cronbach's alpha at baseline = 0.83) [ 53], a tool that has been validated in Vietnam [ 54]. A composite PHQ-9 score was calculated for each participant. Based on the standard scoring method used for the PHQ-9, those who scored zero to four were categorized as screening negative for depressive symptoms, and those who scored above four were categorized as screening positive for depressive symptoms [ 55]. A binary measure was also used as the distribution of PHQ-9 scores was highly skewed at baseline.
